page.title: 12Victorian Weekend S.Clifton
page.content: A substantial sum of money was required to finance repairs at St.Georges Church,North Clifton.To provide this a committee was formed to organise a Victorian Weekend in South Clifton.The first weekend in July 1984 was chosen.The village was completely closed to traffic after 10am on the Saturday and Sunday.Stalls were erected in the village streets by the inhabitants and decorated gaily.A prize was awarded for the best dressed stall.All the villagers dressed in Victorian costume and strolled round the village.Some of the highlights apart from ths stalls were a steam engine giving rides to the church to see a flower display with taped singing by the schoolchildren of songs sung in 1884,an exhibition of bygones in the school,demonstrations of spinning,maypole dancing,Morris dancin
